 Not necessarily. Oil is Iran's "cash crop". It's what they export to get international currencies. Every bit of oil they burn is less money they take in. I don't pretend to understand international monetary and fuel markets, but it seems quite plausible to me that exporting oil and importing uranium may make the most economic sense for Iran.
 
 The point, though, is that we don't need to rub our chins and go "Hmmm, that's suspicious." If they are planning to enrich uranium for a bomb, we'll be able to tell long before they have enough for us to worry about. A simple inspection regime can ensure that no uranium gets enriched past what's needed for a reactor. We should be demanding that they allow inspections, instead of trying to prevent them from doing something which is within their rights.
